-- Security Events Simulation based on system data
WITH security_events AS (
  SELECT COUNT(*) as base_events FROM system_info WHERE timestamp >= NOW() - INTERVAL '24 hours'
),
simulated_security AS (
  SELECT 
    base_events +
    -- Simulate file events based on system activity
    CASE WHEN base_events > 0 THEN base_events * 15 ELSE 0 END +
    -- Simulate process events
    CASE WHEN base_events > 0 THEN base_events * 8 ELSE 0 END +
    -- Simulate network events
    CASE WHEN base_events > 0 THEN base_events * 12 ELSE 0 END
    as total_events
  FROM security_events
)
SELECT total_events as "Security Events (24h)"
FROM simulated_security

-- Threat Level Calculation based on system performance
WITH threat_indicators AS (
  SELECT 
    cpu_usage,
    ((total_memory - available_memory)::float / total_memory::float) * 100 as memory_usage,
    disk_usage
  FROM system_info 
  ORDER BY timestamp DESC 
  LIMIT 1
),
threat_level AS (
  SELECT 
    CASE 
      WHEN cpu_usage > 90 OR memory_usage > 95 THEN 5  -- Critical
      WHEN cpu_usage > 80 OR memory_usage > 85 THEN 4  -- High
      WHEN cpu_usage > 70 OR memory_usage > 75 THEN 3  -- Medium
      WHEN cpu_usage > 60 OR memory_usage > 65 THEN 2  -- Low
      ELSE 1  -- Minimal
    END as threat_score
  FROM threat_indicators
)
SELECT threat_score as "Threat Level"
FROM threat_level

-- Security Posture Score
WITH security_metrics AS (
  SELECT 
    cpu_usage,
    ((total_memory - available_memory)::float / total_memory::float) * 100 as memory_usage,
    disk_usage,
    uptime
  FROM system_info 
  ORDER BY timestamp DESC 
  LIMIT 1
),
security_score AS (
  SELECT 
    -- Base score calculation
    100 - 
    -- Penalize high resource usage (potential compromise)
    CASE WHEN cpu_usage > 80 THEN 20 ELSE cpu_usage * 0.15 END -
    CASE WHEN memory_usage > 85 THEN 15 ELSE memory_usage * 0.1 END -
    CASE WHEN disk_usage > 90 THEN 25 ELSE disk_usage * 0.05 END +
    -- Bonus for system stability (uptime)
    CASE WHEN uptime > 86400 THEN 10 ELSE uptime / 8640 END
    as score
  FROM security_metrics
)
SELECT 
  CASE 
    WHEN score > 100 THEN 100
    WHEN score < 0 THEN 0
    ELSE score
  END as "Security Posture Score"
FROM security_score

-- Active Monitoring Agents
WITH agent_activity AS (
  SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT agent_id) as active_agents
  FROM system_info 
  WHERE timestamp >= NOW() - INTERVAL '5 minutes'
),
total_agents AS (
  SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT agent_id) as total_agents
  FROM system_info
)
SELECT 
  COALESCE(active_agents, 0) as "Active Agents"
FROM agent_activity

-- Real-time Threat Detection Timeline
WITH threat_timeline AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    -- Calculate dynamic threat levels based on system metrics
    CASE 
      WHEN cpu_usage > 90 OR ((total_memory - available_memory)::float / total_memory::float) * 100 > 95 THEN 5
      WHEN cpu_usage > 80 OR ((total_memory - available_memory)::float / total_memory::float) * 100 > 85 THEN 4
      WHEN cpu_usage > 70 OR ((total_memory - available_memory)::float / total_memory::float) * 100 > 75 THEN 3
      WHEN cpu_usage > 60 OR ((total_memory - available_memory)::float / total_memory::float) * 100 > 65 THEN 2
      ELSE 1
    END as "Threat Level",
    -- Security index calculation
    (100 - cpu_usage * 0.5 - ((total_memory - available_memory)::float / total_memory::float) * 50) / 20 as "Security Index",
    -- Anomaly detection
    CASE 
      WHEN ABS(cpu_usage - LAG(cpu_usage) OVER (ORDER BY timestamp)) > 20 THEN 3
      WHEN ABS(cpu_usage - LAG(cpu_usage) OVER (ORDER BY timestamp)) > 10 THEN 2
      ELSE 1
    END as "Anomaly Level"
  FROM system_info 
  WHERE timestamp >= NOW() - INTERVAL '3 hours'
  ORDER BY timestamp
)
SELECT 
  timestamp as time,
  "Threat Level",
  "Security Index",
  "Anomaly Level"
FROM threat_timeline
ORDER BY timestamp

-- Intelligent Event Classification
WITH event_simulation AS (
  SELECT 
    COUNT(*) as system_events,
    -- Simulate different event types based on system activity patterns
    CASE 
      WHEN COUNT(*) > 50 THEN COUNT(*) * 0.4  -- High activity = more file events
      ELSE COUNT(*) * 0.2
    END as file_events,
    CASE 
      WHEN COUNT(*) > 30 THEN COUNT(*) * 0.3  -- Network activity simulation
      ELSE COUNT(*) * 0.15
    END as network_events,
    CASE 
      WHEN COUNT(*) > 40 THEN COUNT(*) * 0.35  -- Process events
      ELSE COUNT(*) * 0.2
    END as process_events,
    CASE 
      WHEN MAX(cpu_usage) > 80 THEN COUNT(*) * 0.1  -- Security events based on high CPU
      ELSE COUNT(*) * 0.02
    END as security_events
  FROM system_info 
  WHERE timestamp >= NOW() - INTERVAL '1 hour'
)
SELECT 'File Events' as "Event Type", file_events as "Count" FROM event_simulation
UNION ALL
SELECT 'Network Events' as "Event Type", network_events as "Count" FROM event_simulation
UNION ALL
SELECT 'Process Events' as "Event Type", process_events as "Count" FROM event_simulation
UNION ALL
SELECT 'Security Events' as "Event Type", security_events as "Count" FROM event_simulation
UNION ALL
SELECT 'System Events' as "Event Type", system_events as "Count" FROM event_simulation

-- Intelligent Security Assessment
WITH security_analysis AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    hostname,
    agent_id,
    cpu_usage,
    ((total_memory - available_memory)::float / total_memory::float) * 100 as memory_usage,
    disk_usage,
    uptime,
    -- Risk calculation
    CASE 
      WHEN cpu_usage > 90 OR ((total_memory - available_memory)::float / total_memory::float) * 100 > 95 THEN 5
      WHEN cpu_usage > 80 OR ((total_memory - available_memory)::float / total_memory::float) * 100 > 85 THEN 4
      WHEN cpu_usage > 70 OR ((total_memory - available_memory)::float / total_memory::float) * 100 > 75 THEN 3
      WHEN cpu_usage > 60 OR ((total_memory - available_memory)::float / total_memory::float) * 100 > 65 THEN 2
      ELSE 1
    END as risk_level,
    -- Security score
    GREATEST(0, LEAST(100, 
      100 - cpu_usage * 0.3 - ((total_memory - available_memory)::float / total_memory::float) * 30 - disk_usage * 0.2
    )) as security_score,
    -- Threat category
    CASE 
      WHEN cpu_usage > 85 AND ((total_memory - available_memory)::float / total_memory::float) * 100 > 90 THEN 'Resource Exhaustion'
      WHEN cpu_usage > 95 THEN 'CPU Spike Anomaly'
      WHEN ((total_memory - available_memory)::float / total_memory::float) * 100 > 95 THEN 'Memory Pressure'
      WHEN disk_usage > 95 THEN 'Storage Critical'
      WHEN uptime < 3600 THEN 'Recent Restart'
      ELSE 'Normal Operation'
    END as threat_category
  FROM system_info 
  ORDER BY timestamp DESC
  LIMIT 15
)
SELECT 
  timestamp as "Last Seen",
  hostname as "Endpoint",
  LEFT(agent_id, 12) || '...' as "Agent ID",
  risk_level as "Risk Level",
  security_score as "Security Score",
  threat_category as "Threat Category",
  ROUND(cpu_usage, 1) || '%' as "CPU",
  ROUND(memory_usage, 1) || '%' as "Memory",
  ROUND(disk_usage, 1) || '%' as "Disk"
FROM security_analysis
ORDER BY risk_level DESC, timestamp DESC
